intro: Oldenlandia heynei var. djalonis, commonly known as the African catchfly, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a herbaceous annual with opposite, linear to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four white petals and five stamens, typical of the Acanthaceae family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its delicate appearance.
